body_html:
NumPy seems to be using an unusual rounding mode by default called Round half to even. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rounding#Tie-breaking

TensorFlow uses the same standard rounding as all other scientific tools I have available (Octave, Silverfrost Fortran and Gnu Fortran) called Round half away from zero

Edit: No tests should ever use round due to the 6 or so different ways to do it. Use floor or ceil (round to -inf and +inf) which offers no ambiguity.
body_text:
NumPy seems to be using an unusual rounding mode by default called Round half to even. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rounding#Tie-breaking
TensorFlow uses the same standard rounding as all other scientific tools I have available (Octave, Silverfrost Fortran and Gnu Fortran) called Round half away from zero
Edit: No tests should ever use round due to the 6 or so different ways to do it. Use floor or ceil (round to -inf and +inf) which offers no ambiguity.
body:
NumPy seems to be using an unusual rounding mode by default called _Round half to even_. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rounding#Tie-breaking 

TensorFlow uses the same standard rounding as all other scientific tools I have available (Octave, Silverfrost Fortran and Gnu Fortran) called _Round half away from zero_

Edit: No _tests_ should ever use `round` due to the 6 or so different ways to do it. Use `floor` or `ceil` (round to -inf and +inf) which offers no ambiguity.
